qas.question: What was the name of Universal's German production unit?
Who ran Universal's German production unit?
In what year did Deutsche Universal-Film AG open?
How many films did Universal's German subsidiary make yearly?
Along with Germany and Austria, where was Deutsche Universal-Film AG at one time based?
How many films did Deutsche Universal-Film AG produce in 1936?
Where did Universal Pictures distribute the subsidiary's films?

context: In <a2_0>1926<a2_0/>, Universal opened a production unit in Germany, <a0_0><b5_0>Deutsche Universal-Film AG<b5_0/><a0_0/>, under the direction of <a1_0><b6_0>Joe Pasternak<b6_0/><a1_0/>. This unit produced <a3_0><b7_0>three to four<b7_0/><a3_0/> films per year until 1936, migrating to <a4_0>Hungary<a4_0/> and then Austria in the face of Hitler's increasing domination of central Europe. With the advent of sound, these productions were made in the German language or, occasionally, Hungarian or Polish. In the U.S., Universal Pictures did not distribute any of this subsidiary's films, but at least some of them were exhibited through other, independent, foreign-language film distributors based in <b8_0>New York<b8_0/>, without benefit of English subtitles. Nazi persecution and a change in ownership for the parent Universal Pictures organization resulted in the dissolution of this subsidiary.
